annotation.summary: Describes the movement distance an ancestry member can travel when using an action like Stride.
annotation.action_economy: Uses one action to move a specified distance.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have an ancestry with a defined movement speed.

annotation.summary: Describes the starting languages known by characters of a specific ancestry and how additional languages can be gained based on a positive Intelligence modifier.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have an ancestry; additional languages require an Intelligence modifier of +1 or higher.

annotation.summary: Starting characters may only select 1st-level ancestry feats, but higher-level characters can choose any ancestry feat of their level or lower. Some feats have prerequisites that must be met before selection.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this rule governs feat selection, not actions during play.
annotation.prerequisites: Varies by feat; each may list specific conditions that must be fulfilled before selection.

annotation.summary: You can learn a number of additional languages equal to 1 plus your positive Intelligence modifier, chosen from common or otherwise accessible languages.
annotation.prerequisites: Positive Intelligence modifier grants additional languages

annotation.summary: You can learn a number of additional languages equal to your positive Intelligence modifier, selecting from common languages or those available based on your background or origin.

Barathus are shape-shifting aberrant beings capable of altering their genetic code and merging into new forms. Younger barathus are curious and individualistic, while older ones become more communal and spiritually connected, with some retreating into personal dreamlike realities.

Barathus are amorphous beings whose sense of identity evolves through merging with others. Young barathus are more individualistic but gradually adopt a collective mindset as they gain experience. They can combine into conglomerates—new entities with unique personalities and perspectives. When separated, individuals retain only vague memories of the shared existence. Older barathus often embrace permanent merger as a natural culmination of life, joining a greater collective consciousness.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a barathu capable of merging with others of its kind.

annotation.summary: The character has been transformed by contact with Liavara's cosmic melody, gaining the ability to express that experience through song. They can select one occult cantrip and cast it at will as an occult innate spell, with its rank equal to half their level rounded up.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by chosen cantrip (typically 2 actions to cast)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have communed with the cosmic melody of Liavara or similar experience

annotation.summary: Allows the character to spend 10 minutes meditating to replace their chosen cantrip with another from the occult spell list once per day.

A young and inexperienced barathu with a mutable form that has not yet specialized or merged with others. The character is Small, gains the Quick Squeeze feat, and has resistance to precision damage equal to half their level (minimum 1).
annotation.prerequisites: Barathu ancestry; represents a young or undeveloped barathu.

annotation.summary: During daily preparations, the character selects one common 2nd-rank occult spell and can cast it once as an innate occult spell before the next preparations.
annotation.action_economy: No specific action required; selection occurs during daily preparations.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to perform daily preparations and access to the occult spell list.

annotation.summary: You can learn extra languages equal to 1 plus your positive Intelligence modifier, selecting from common or otherwise accessible languages.
You can learn a number of additional languages equal to your positive Intelligence modifier, selecting from common languages or those available based on your background or setting.
